intro: Ononis viscosa proles breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous minute seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in rocky or dry environments.
